short_summary: TBIPS Business Analysis and Functional Services
description: Trade Agreement: CETA/WTO-AGP/CPTPP/CFTA/FTAs with Peru/Colombia/Panama/Korea/UK \\(n)Tendering Procedures: Suppliers on permanent list or able to meet qualification requirements \\(n)Competitive Procurement Strategy: Best Overall Proposal \\(n)Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No \\(n)Nature of Requirements: TBIPS Business Analysis and Functional Services  B8947-220390/A Dupuis, Sébastien Telephone No. - (873) 354-0246 (    ) \\(n)This requirement is for: Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) \\(n)Only TBIPS Supply Arrangement (SA) Holders currently holding a TBIPS SA for Tier 2 in the resource categories detailed below in the National Capital Region under the EN578-170432 series of SAs are eligible to compete. The TBIPS SA EN578-170432 is incorporated by reference and forms part of this bid solicitation, as though expressly set out in it, subject to any express terms and conditions contained in this bid solicitation. \\(n)Should you require more information on how to become a qualified TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holder, please contact the Manager of the Informatics Method of Supply (IMOS) at: rcnmdai.-ncrimos@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca \\(n)Submission of Bids: This bid solicitation allows bidders to use Canada Post Corporation’s (CPC) Connect service to transmit their bid electronically. To submit a bid using the CPC Connect service, the Bidder must either i) send directly its bid only to the specified PWGSC Bid Receiving Unit, using its own licensing agreement for CPC Connect provided by Canada Post Corporation; or ii) if the Bidder does not have its own licensing agreement for CPC Connect, they have to request to open a CPC Connect conversation by emailing PWGSC Bid Receiving Unit at tpsgc.pareceptiondessoumissions-apbidreceiving.pwgsc@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca \\(n)This request should be sent as early as possible, and in any case, at least six business days prior to the solicitation closing date and time (in order to ensure a response).  Requests to open a CPC Connect conversation received after that time may not be answered. \\(n)For additional information on the submission of bids using CPC Connect, please refer to the RFP. \\(n)Description of the requirement: The scope of this requirement is for the provision of services on an 'as and when requested' basis for the following resource categories: A.2 Enterprise Resource Planning Functional Analyst, Level 2; B.1 Business Analyst, Level 2; and B.1 Business Analyst, Level 3 \\(n)Number and proposed period of contract(s): It is intended to result in the award of up to three contracts. Each contract will be for two years plus three one-year irrevocable options allowing Canada to extend the term of the contract. \\(n)Anticipated Start Date: February 2023 \\(n)Security Requirement: SRCL: Common PS SRCL #19 Bidder Minimum Security Level Required: SECRET Resource Minimum Security Level Required: RELIABILITY \\(n)There are security requirements associated with this requirement.  For additional information, consult Part 6 - Security, Financial and Other Requirements, and Part 7 - Resulting Contract Clauses. \\(n)For more information on personnel and organization security screening or security clauses, Bidders should refer to the Contract Security Program of Public Works and Government Services Canada (http://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/introduction-eng.html) website. \\(n)Accessible Procurement: Public Services and Procurement Canada’s goal is to ensure that the goods and services the Government of Canada (GC) buys are inclusive by design and accessible by default. Considering accessibility in public procurements is now an obligation in the Treasury Board Contracting Policy and accessibility criteria must be included in the requirements for goods and services, where appropriate. \\(n)Incumbents: Name of Contractor: Coradix Technology Consulting Ltd. Contract Period: 18-Jan-2018 to 17-Jan-2023 Contract Value: $5,641,863.14 (applicable taxes included) \\(n)Name of Contractor: Procom Consultants Group Ltd. Contract Period: 18-Jan-2018 to 17-Jan-2023 Contract Value: $5,581,539.99 (applicable taxes included) \\(n)Name of Contractor: TPG Technology Consulting Ltd. Contract Period: 18-Jan-2018 to 17-Jan-2023 Contract Value: $5,548,027.12 (applicable taxes included) \\(n)Enquiries: All questions in relation to this solicitation must be sent via email to Sébastien Dupuis at Sebastien.Dupuis@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca \\(n)Delivery Date: Above-mentioned \\(n)The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. \\(n)Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
full_summary:
**Trade Agreement:**
Canada has signed various trade agreements to facilitate international trade, including the Canada-Europe Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (WTO-AGP), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Transpacific Partnership (CPTPP), the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement (PAT), the Canada-European Union Trade Agreement, and the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (PAT).

**Notice Type and Method:**
The Government of Canada is soliciting proposals for the provision of business analysis and functional services through a competitive tendering process. Eligible suppliers must be a TBIPS Supply Arrangement (SA) holder under the EN578-170432 series of SAs and hold a TBIPS SA for Tier 2 in the resource categories of Enterprise Resource Planning Functional Analyst, Level 2, Business Analyst, Level 2, and Business Analyst, Level 3.

**Scope of Work:**
The procurement aims to procure services on an "as and when requested" basis for the following resource categories:

* A.2 Enterprise Resource Planning Functional Analyst, Level 2;
* B.1 Business Analyst, Level 2; and
* B.1 Business Analyst, Level 3.

**Contract Period:**
The contract will be awarded for a period of two years, with three one-year irrevocable options allowing Canada to extend the term of the contract.

**Security Requirements:**
The requirement has multiple security requirements associated with it. Suppliers must be aware of these requirements and be able to meet the necessary security clearances. Bidders should refer to the Contract Security Program of Public Works and Government Services Canada for more information.

**Accessibility Procurement:**
The Government of Canada aims to ensure that its procurement is inclusive and accessible by design and default. This procurement requires suppliers to meet the accessibility criteria outlined in the Treasury Board Contracting Policy.

**Submission of Proposals:**
Proponents can submit their proposals through the Canada Post Corporation's (CPC) Connect service or by emailing the Bid Receiving Unit. Please refer to the Request for Proposal (RFP) for more information on the submission process.

**Closing Date:**
The closing date for this request for proposal is [insert date]. All questions and bids must be submitted on or before this date to be considered.

**Contact Information:**
Refer to the contact information provided in the document for more information.
